pros: -Great mission so feel proud to do the work -Great time off -Opportunities to travel
cons: -Not many opportunities for advancement

review_title: Not a good place to work
pros: Working with amazing kids. Lots of opportunities to gain experience in various areas.
cons: Low pay. Lack of recognition.

review_title: Good place to work while in school
job_title: After School Program Leader in Fredericton, NB
pros: Flexible schedule Great work experience No weekends
cons: Sometimes it can be a stressful environment

job_title: Boys and Girls Club Camp Counselor in Lindsay, ON
pros: Great experience for students looking to become teachers as it gets you ready to deal with 20+ kids with little training and no support.
cons:
Hires young students who probably never had a different job so that they can take advantage of them (promising hours/vacations and not giving them, not giving breaks during long summer camp days, not compensating for gas when promising to do so, etc.) Many employees did not receive their pay for months at a time and kept being brushed off when it was brought up. 
Supervisors and managers do not take care of their subordinates. All they do is complain about the person above them while their employees are being emotionally and sometimes physically abused by parents, children, and other staff members.

pros: Front line staff are kind
cons: Management does not seem to care. Upper management does not have any accountability over mid-level management and there are unreasonable expectations. Extreme lack of diversity in management.

job_title: After School Program Leader in Toronto, ON
pros: I love working for BGC Canada because it's all about the youth. Contributing to their growth and development is my passion and I definitely get to do this at BGC Canada!
cons: Pay isn't very high for after-school program leaders.

pros: Enriching experiences, amazing children and youth, close-knit staff team, and flexible hours in certain departments.
cons: Toxic work environment caused by management. Management does not take complaints seriously and will bully anyone who stands up for themselves or others. Management will overwork you, harass you, and degrade you. Pay continues to go down as new staff begin, but with wage confidentially policies, it’s impossible to advocate for yourself. Many people starting at below my starting wage in 2018. The majority of the jobs are temporary and there is very little job security.

job_title: After School Program Leader in Toronto, ON
pros: Flexibile and accommodating to schedule. Nice experience working with the kids. Co-workers and management are nice to work with.
cons: Can get a bit unorganized

job_title: Residence Worker in Niagara Falls, ON
pros: Great, supportive staff team. Reasonable and supportive management. Have the opportunity to run the shift with independence.
cons: Would like an increase in pay. Benefits aren't great, but have some. Staff turn over an issue.

job_title: Early Childhood Educator in Kamloops, BC
pros: There were regular team building activities
cons: There are no downsides to working here

pros: Family atmosphere amongst the staff
cons: Some complacency and fear to change

flexible hours

pros:
- Was able to move through several different roles (started as an after school program worker, then worked in camps, then moved into group homes) so was able to gain a lot of valuable experience.
- provided significant quality training- I'd say training at least once per month, and you were always paid for your time while attending training, as well as getting to participate in training (often costly training if you'd done it privately). 
- I enjoyed the work, managers were generally really good
cons:
- pay was fairly low (though that's uniform generally throughout all youth work jobs, I think)
- turnover in group homes was massive, which made it more difficult to build a strong vision for the program

pros: Easy to move up as the place is a revolving door. Lots of family/life balance, full-time employees come and go as they please. Pay was extremely good for those of us in the office/full-time.
cons: This place was completely backwards to all other experiences I had in the non-profit industry. There is little to no accountability to anyone, management is very poor and I always felt they were not working toward the good of the company (I was also management). They were dishonest and always looked for a quick fix. The office morale was very poor and if BGCC knew what was happening they'd be appalled.

review_title: Good Services, TERRIBLE place to work
pros: The work they do in the community is great.  If you are front-line workers, it's a great place to be. Work/life balance is great.
cons:
They are incredibly disorganized, and have no idea what they are doing. They grew too big, too fast, and continue to try to operate like a mom and pop shop. They say they are wanting to operate better, yet when you're actually there, you are slapped on the wrist for trying to change things. 
Leadership is sorely lacking in experience leading and being forward-thinking. 

Their fundraising is a joke, and they heavily rely on grants to operate. They simply are not staffed to be able to accomplish what they "want to do." There is so much room for improvement, but the people in place are arguably not equipped to make it happen.

job_title: Part Time Child and Youth Worker in Toronto, ON
pros:
The kids, the staff team and superiors are usually always a group of INCREDIBLE people! 
Flexibility: given opportunity to really facilitate your own program. 
Pay : above average for most NPO part-time gigs.
Unionized.
cons:
A lot of young staff: can create a challenge to work with. Sometimes, having to deal with 'childish' behaviour. 
Pay + Hours: Pay is above average, however - 3pm-6pm isn't enough hours to survive cost of living in toronto. 
No benefit packages (yet... We pay union dues)

pros: Very rewarding. Clients are sweet! There are some perks but not money! Very community oriented! Very gratifying work! Warm fuzzy feeling of helping the less fortunate! Volunteering is encouraged! Great place for kids and young adults to get volunteer hours whether it's school mandated or court ordered!
cons: Poor Wages and no benefits. Long hours for minimum wages. Volunteering is mandatory! No accolades from senior staff. The higher levels of staff unfriendly to junior staff. Lack of communication between departments! Very clicky!

job_title: Summer Camp Counsellor in Toronto, ON
pros: The experience and opportunities are always available and coming your way. You meet people of all walks of life and helps you interact with anyone and everyone.
cons: Can be unorganized at times because of the constant rush. Sometimes people are given a higher position, or a position in general and don't deserve it. Trips and Supplies can sometimes vary on the sponsorship or grants given.

pros: The employees are all very easy to get along with, there is a general positivity and passion among the staff.  It is a very good stepping stone employer.
cons: Staff are underpaid and expected to take an ethical discount, as in you get paid less because you can feel good about where you work.

review_title: Frontline Staff Committed to Children, Youth, and Families
pros: Great place to get experience in the social services sector. Great work/life balance. Most mnagers genuinely care about your well-being and understand that self-care contributes to work performance. The mission to create safe spaces for children and youth to learn and grow is so easy to get onboard with.
cons: Some of the standard problems in the non-profit sector, such as limited programming budgets, no overtime, and a bit touchy-feely (in meetings and so forth) at times (for my taste).

review_title: Great for youth employment/students with a lot of energy
job_title: Summer Camp Counsellor in Mississauga, ON
pros: Organization is very open to different ideas and welcomes different age groups and ethnic backgrounds into the organization. Very laidback work environment as a camp leader.
cons: Can become difficult to run activities outdoors during the hot summer months. As a nonprofit, the lack of funding with limited indoor supplies.  Working in low income areas, sometimes you get kids who are "difficult" so to speak.

pros:
Get to work with children from diverse and vulnerable communities.
Teach them how to become self motivated.
Be an inspiration/mentor
cons: Low pay for what is required. Limited resources for children development .

pros: A lot of programs, some do great works for the community, all depends on the manager of that particular program.
cons: White only, no - white need not apply if you want any type or form of advancement or promotion. Last time I checked, they have 1 non- white manager among all their program, that's including their indigenous program, the coordinator and the manager are white.......they preach deversity, but there is no deversity inside this organization. All the main roles in leadership team are all buddies and all white.

job_title: Youth Guidance Worker in Williams Lake, BC
pros: Really a great place to expand knowledge in the human service area. Each B&G club has a different system when working with children and youth, but the core values are still the same. Loved this company!
cons: Nothing, keep helping the kids!

review_title: Not a great place to be
pros:
-Flexible work environment
-Good hours
-Good professional development and opportunities to try new ideas
-Staff are kind and collaborative
cons:
-Poor Communication between staff, management and clubs 
-Micro managing, unsupportive management 
-Staff are underpaid; minimal room for advancement/raises - "nonprofit martyr" complex
-Work culture does not offer room for much collaboration; bureaucratic processes
-Overall work environment was negative which was why I moved on

pros:
Great working community
Opportunity to make a difference
Great resume builder for anyone seeking future employment in Education, Social Services, Policing, etc
cons:
Low pay
Feels like a lack of support from management

job_title: After-School Program Activity Leader in Toronto, ON
pros: Inclusive environment and a great place for a student looking to enter the workforce!  Supportive supervisors. Good balance of work and fun.
cons: Provide further training or development workshops in leadership, time management, et cetera.

pros: The Boys and Girls club is a great place to work if you enjoy working with children. They provide many activities for the campers, and make the day fun as an employee.
cons: Sometimes the children do not listen to you, which can be frustrating at times.

pros: I got to build relationships with children of all races and religion, it was inspiring and very beautiful to be around. I loved getting to know everyone and being able to understand their backgrounds a little more.
cons: Some of the kids don’t listen.

review_title: Fun place to work if you kids. If you you're looking to make a decent wage, this job's not for you!
